snippet: State Senator Daniel L. Squadron’s bill would raise the minimum wage to $15 an hour for employees of McDonald’s, Walmart and other businesses with yearly sales of $50 million or more.
abstract: Group of Democratic lawmakers from New York City announce new push to raise minimum wage for many low-paid workers, calling for $15-an-hour 'fair wage' for employees of businesses with yearly sales of $50 million or more; State Sen Daniel L Squadron's bill would also apply to chain stores and restaurants with at least 11 locations nationwide, and businesses involved with transportation.
lead_paragraph: State Senator Daniel L. Squadron’s bill would raise the minimum wage to $15 an hour for employees of McDonald’s, Walmart and other businesses with yearly sales of $50 million or more.

headline.main: New York Lawmakers Push to Raise Wages at Biggest Chains
headline.print_headline: Bill Would Lift Wages at Biggest Chains
